Package main.java.rintalatuukka.contacts.objects

Class Address

java.lang.Object
main.java.rintalatuukka.contacts.objects.Address
All Implemented Interfaces:
Info
public class Address extends Object implements Info
This object contains the info for a finnish addresses and methods to manipulate that data.
Author:
Tuukka Rintala

  • Constructor Details

    • Address

      public Address()
      This constructor is used for creating empty Address objects.

    • Address

      public Address(String startInfo)
      This is a constructor which recieves its information in the argument. The information is stored using setInfo, so that it is validated and throws an exception if the data is invalid.
      Parameters:
      startInfo - a String containing a finnish address, with the street address, zipcode and city separated by a '.'.

  • Method Details

    • getInfo

      public String getInfo()
      Description copied from interface: Info
      This method is implemented to get the information that is stored onto a text file from this object. The method is used specifically to store data from this object into a text file, so it should be validated and stored in a way that will not cause errors when importing it later.
      Specified by:
      getInfo in interface Info
      Returns:
      a String containing contact information that is formatted in a way that can be read by this program.

    • setInfo

      public void setInfo(String newInfo)
      Description copied from interface: Info
      This method is implemented to be able to change the information in the object while validating it. The method should be implemented such that each time new information is stored it is validated, and throws an error if invalid and non-optional, otherwise we risk storing invalidly formatted data in the text file.
      Specified by:
      setInfo in interface Info
      Parameters:
      newInfo - is a String containing the information you wish to store.

    • updateInfo

      public void updateInfo()
      This method updates the information to contain the current street address, zip code and city separated by dots.

    • setStreet

      public void setStreet(String newStreet, boolean constructor)
      This method sets the street address of this object. Also adds a dot to separate from zip code and city.
      Parameters:
      newStreet - a String containing the new street address.
      constructor - a boolean that informs the method if its being run from a constructor.

    • setZipCode

      public void setZipCode(String newZip, boolean constructor)
      This method sets the zip code of this object. Also adds a dot to separate from the street address and city.
      Parameters:
      newZip - a String containing the new zip code.
      constructor - a boolean that informs the method if its being run from a constructor.

    • setCity

      public void setCity(String newCity, boolean constructor)
      This method sets the city of this object. Does not add a dot because it is the last value in this object.
      Parameters:
      newCity - a String containing the new city.
      constructor - a boolean that informs the method if its being run from a constructor.

    • validateStreet

      public boolean validateStreet(String newInfo)
      This method validates if the argument is a correctly formatted street address. A regular expression is compiled to check that the first letter is capitalised, and the rest of that word is not and isn't too long, the next part is the street number and can be up to three numbers long. Lastly there is an option to include an apartment number that includes your staircase. It is then matched against the argument.
      Parameters:
      newInfo - a String containing the street address we wish to validate.
      Returns:
      a boolean denoting whether the argument was valid.

    • validateZip

      public boolean validateZip(String newInfo)
      This method validates if the argument is a correctly formatted zip code. A regular expression is compiled to check if there are 5 numbers.It is then matched against the argument.
      Parameters:
      newInfo - a String containing the zip code§ we wish to validate.
      Returns:
      a boolean denoting whether the argument was valid.

    • validateCity

      public boolean validateCity(String newInfo)
      This method validates if the argument is a correctly formatted city. A regular expression is compiled to check that the first letter is capitalised and that it isn't too long. It is then matched against the argument.
      Parameters:
      newInfo - a String containing the last name we wish to validate.
      Returns:
      a boolean denoting whether the argument was valid.

    • inputInfo

      public void inputInfo()
      Description copied from interface: Info
      This method is implemented to get new information from the user and store it into this object. The method should get inputs from the user until we get a valid one if the information is non-optional. If it is optional, first ask the user if they wish to add this information.
      Specified by:
      inputInfo in interface Info

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Description copied from interface: Info
      This method is implemented to retrieve the information from the object in a way that can be displayed correctly in the console. This method is called when we wish to print this objects information into the console. This is relevant if the object contains more than one piece of information that need to be separated differently in the text file than the console.
      Specified by:
      toString in interface Info
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a String containing the information from this object that can be displayed correctly.
